name: 黑衣陶刻符贯耳罐
intro:
高12厘米，口径8.8厘米
澄湖遗址出土，新石器时代良渚文化时期
此器作方唇、直口、高领、溜肩鼓腹、平底，颈下部饰凸弦纹一周，两侧置对称贯耳，器表打磨光滑。外腹部有四个刻划符号，呈左高右低中间略高的形式横向排列，为陶器烧成后用锋刃器刻出。关于这四个刻划符号的考释，学术界众说纷纭，或说为文字的先行形态。
Jar with Tubular Ears
Material: Pottery
Period: Prehistoric Period
Height: 12cm, Mouth Diameter: 8.8cm
Excavated from the Chenghu Lake Site, Liangzhu Culture of Neolithic Period
The jar is designed with a square rim, a straight mouth, a bulged belly, a flat bottom, convex horizontal lines under the neck, and tubular ears. Four symbols are inscribed by sharp tools on the outer belly of this pot, which are arranged horizontally. In the academic circle, there are different opinions on the interpretation of the four symbols. Some believe that they are primitive characters.

name: 三山岛哺乳动物化石
intro:
三山岛哺乳动物化石的大致年代在距今 21500 年至 12300 年之间。大量哺乳动物群的存在及古地理研究表明，三山岛在其时并非孤悬太湖之上的小岛，而应与现在太湖周边陆地连成一体，属平原丘陵地形，山上树木葱茏，平原遍布草地，动物成群，气候较现在更加寒冷。化石地点出土大量动物化石，主要包括虎、犀牛、最后鬣狗、棕 熊、黑熊、猞猁、狼、獾、豪猪、鼬、猕猴、貘、鹿、牛、兔等。
Mammal Fossils of the Sanshan Island
Material: Other
Period: Prehistoric Period
The mammal fossils of the Sanshan Island are roughly dated between 21,500 and 12,300 years ago. The presence of a large number of mammalian fauna and paleogeographic studies indicate that Sanshan Island was not a small island on Taihu Lake at that time, but was integrated with the present land around Taihu Lake and was a plain and hilly terrain with lush trees on the hills, grasslands all over the plains, flocks of animals, and a colder climate than today. A large number of animal fossils were excavated, including fossils of tigers, rhinoceroses, spotted hyenas, brown bears, black bears, lynxes, wolves, badgers, porcupines, skunks, macaques, tapirs, deer, cows, rabbits, etc.

name: 宽鋬带流黑陶杯
intro:
新石器时代·良渚文化
高16.7厘米，底径7.1厘米
澄湖遗址出土
该种陶杯为良渚时期盛水器中的典型器，在澄湖遗址1974年的清理中出土了两件，造型相同。器物为泥质灰胎黑衣，侈口，束颈，折肩，直筒腹微鼓，平底附圈足，口沿一侧出鸭嘴形宽流，肩腹部置宽扁环形鋬，鋬上端钻两小孔。器形规整，器壁厚薄均匀，器表打磨光滑，鋬、流独特，充分反映了当时高超的制陶水平和独特的审美情趣。

name: 彩绘陶罐
intro:
高10.6厘米，口径8厘米
澄湖遗址出土，新石器时代良渚文化时期
这件贯耳壶为良渚文化陶器的典型器，作直口、方唇、高颔、弧肩、圆鼓腹、假圈足、平底，口沿两侧置有对称的牛鼻形贯耳，颈部施黄彩，肩腹部绘弦纹和水波纹组成的装饰带。整器造型规整，彩绘色调明快。良渚文化时期的彩绘陶有两种，一种是漆绘陶器，用天然漆涂绘在陶器上形成花纹；另一种是彩绘陶，用自然矿石粉颜料涂绘。此器属前者。
Painted Pottery Pot with Tubular Ears
Material: Pottery
Period: Prehistoric Period
Height: 10.6cm, Mouth Diameter: 8cm
Excavated from the Chenghu Lake Site, Liangzhu Culture of Neolithic Period
This pot with tubular ears is a typical artifact of the Neolithic Liangzhu culture. There were two kinds of painted pottery at that time, namely, lacquer-painted pottery which used natural lacquer to paint patterns, and painted pottery which used natural mineral powder for painting. This pot falls into the first category. It is designed with a straight mouth, a square rim, circular shoulders, a round and bulging body, and a flat bottom. Two ox nose shaped tubular ears are arranged on both sides of the rim. The neck is painted in yellow. Its shoulder and belly are decorated with horizontal lines and wave patterns.

name: 夹砂灰陶鬶
intro:
新石器时代·良渚文化
高24.6厘米
澄湖遗址出土
白陶质，扁口细颈，袋足高瘦，足尖锥状，一袋足上附宽扁环把，另两袋足上施篦齿纹和附加堆纹，三足裆下布满烟炱，应为使用所留。陶鬶是流行于新石器时代的一种炊器，酷似鸟形，兼具实用与审美价值。其基本形制为口部带流，颈、腹间有鋬，腹下有三空心足。

name: 至正乙酉朱碧山造银槎杯
intro:
斜长22厘米，宽7.5厘米，高11.4厘米 元代 此器以仙人乘槎凌空飞越到达银河的神话故事为题材，将银酒杯巧制成树槎形的一叶扁舟，有一老人背靠槎尾而坐。槎背部有细瘦阴刻铭文“至正乙酉朱碧山造”，为元代银工朱碧山制作。 这件作品设计精巧，造型奇特，在制作工艺上成功地运用了镂刻、焊等多种技法，结合圆雕、浮雕工艺将人与舟、舟与云气、人与槎树间的层次交待得既简练清晰又融为一体。人物镂刻生动逼真，面部丰颐宽额，隆准凤目，飘动的长须根根分明，细腻而流畅，达到了完美的艺术效果，属难得的工艺珍品。 Silver Raft-shaped Cup Made by Zhu Bishan Material: Metal Period: Yuan Dynasty Hypotenuse Length: 22cm, Width: 7.5cm, Height: 11.4cm This cup indicates a story of an immortal penetrating into the Milky River by raft. Shaped like a branch, the cup has an inscription on its back that means “made by Zhu Bishan in the yiyou year of Zhizheng”. Zhu Bishan was a famous silversmith in the Yuan Dynasty.


With delicate design and unique shape, this cup is made by several techniques such as chasing, soldering, circular carving and enchasing, presenting the layers of the immortal and raft, the raft and cloud, and the immortal and branch in a clear, simple and coordinated way. The cup, with ingenious design and made by exquisite craftsmanship, reflects the high technical level of silver workmanship of the Yuan Dynasty. In this connection, this is an artistic treasure of Yuan silver.

name: 刻画兽面纹灰陶罐
intro:
新石器时代·良渚文化
高10.0厘米，口径8.5厘米，底径9.0厘米
澄湖遗址出土
该灰陶罐在陶系传统上深受崧泽文化余韵影响。浅灰泥胎，敛口斜肩，体如鼓墩，平底厚重，肩部起一周凸棱，上镂四对针眼小孔，器表黑衣剥落严重。肩部的四对针眼小孔，便于系挂，表明此器物应是实用盛器。腹部刻画一周五组图案，发掘者认为分别是猫、鸟、蝶、蛇、鸡等动物形象，颇具生趣。动物图案入胎较深，线条流畅，简洁不失神韵。它是良渚文化早期难得的艺术佳品。

name: 磁州窑白地褐花人物纹罐
intro:
高30.5厘米，口径20.5厘米，足径15.2厘米
磁州窑窑址位于今河北磁县，因宋元时期地属磁州而得名，主要分布于以观台镇和彭城镇为中心的区域。磁州窑是宋金时期北方烧瓷品种最为丰富的一个瓷窑。主要烧造瓶、罐、炉、碗、盘、枕、灯、盆、盒、缸、钵等。白地黑花装饰最具特色，有浓郁的民间生活气息。元代磁州窑系以烧造白釉黑花器为主，产品具有硕大、浑圆、厚重的特点。代表产品即白地黑花大罐。这种大口、敛足、鼓腹的罐在元大都遗址出土过。器腹纹饰常见的有龙凤、花卉或云雁等。

name: 元明蓝釉鱼藻纹坛
intro:
元—明
高14.8厘米，口径7.8厘米，腹径11.5厘米，底径7.9厘米
此坛圆唇，矮颈，丰肩，鼓腹，矮圈足。内壁施白釉，可见清晰的接胎痕迹。外壁通体施蓝釉，有缩釉现象，腹部刻有鱼藻纹饰，四面各刻一鱼，分别是鲭、鲌、鲤、鳜，空间衬以浮萍、水草。底不施釉，旋痕明显，在胎和釉的交接处有一线橙黄色。整器胎体厚重，坚致细密，釉色蓝中带紫，图案纹饰是在坯体上完釉后刻出，鱼体刻得较深，水草、浮萍刻得较浅，属蓝釉器的上乘之作。

name: 釉里红云龙纹盖罐
intro:
通高38.2厘米，口径12.7厘米，腹径25.0厘米，底径13.7厘米
通安华山出土
这件龙纹盖罐直口短颈，丰肩鼓腹，胫部微收，带有底面旋挖而成的假圈足，足端面宽平。盖部有宝珠形纽，盖设里外两口，便于密封。以盖纽为中心施有对称的锦葵花叶一周，纽基部及盖外边缘都施釉里红，花叶上也散涂铜红呈色剂。腹部浅刻盘龙两条，组成主体纹饰。该罐在构图艺术上极有特色，罐表以盘曲升腾的白龙为主体纹饰，龙体上下之间的空白处以艳红的呈色衬托，似为飘动的彩云。两条白龙蜿蜒升腾在片片红云之中，红云白龙，相得益彰，以强烈的色调对比，烘托白龙在红云中升腾的动态美。整器造型端庄，胎白质坚，装饰别致，呈色艳丽，极为难得，是国内外罕见的早期釉里红瓷器。
Underglaze Red Covered Jar with Cloud and Dragon Patterns
Material: Porcelain
Period: Yuan Dynasty
Height: 38.2cm, Mouth Diameter: 12.7cm, Belly Diameter: 25cm, Bottom Diameter: 13.7cm
Underglaze is a method of decorating pottery in which painted decoration is applied to the surface before it is covered with a transparent ceramic glaze and fired in a kiln. The red color is achieved by copper in reduction firing. Since copper is volatile at high temperature, the production of the red color requires strict temperature control. Therefore, the production of such ceramics is dramatically difficult. This jar with cloud and dragon patterns and a lid, with two dragons carved on its belly, is of graceful shape, unique decorations and bright color. Few masterpieces of underglaze red ceramics are preserved to date, and this one is a national treasure.

name: 影青狮象形烛台
intro:
这是一对大小、质地相同，形态略有不同的像生瓷烛台。其形制新颖，别具一格。其中一件为狮形，四足伸展，昂首站立，阔鼻圆眼，眼珠外突，点以黑彩，竖耳，张口，吐舌，露齿，颌下饰以排须，头部披毛下垂，毛发釉层下划以篦纹。另一件为象形，俯首站立，鼓目凝视，眼珠点黑彩，长鼻内卷，鼻侧外露长牙，双耳下垂，耳面影青釉下浅刻几刀，筋脉清晰。头部饰十字形辔带，其上分别堆塑梅、菊六朵。两器腹均中空，腹下均有两个直径 1.0 厘米的小圆孔，背部均置圆柱形卷花口座。身躯贴塑鞍鞯、璎珞，颈贴塑挂铃。器表施青白色釉，堆塑花与座口露橘红色胎。这对狮象烛台是元代景德镇窑采用二元配方选坯技术后的产品，采用了堆、贴、划等多种工艺，造型生动，色泽莹润。这种元代像生瓷烛台极为罕见，堪称稀世之宝。
Shadowy Blue Lion and Elephant Shaped Candle Stickers
Material: Porcelain
Period: Yuan Dynasty
This is a pair of candle stickers of the same size and texture, and slightly different shapes. One candle sticker is in the shape of a lion putting out legs, standing with its head raised, and decorated with comb patterns under the glaze of its fur. The other one is in the shape of an elephant standing with its head bent, staring with bulging eyes, rolling its trunk inward, and decorated with a cross bride on its head. Each of the candle stickers has a hollow belly with two small circular holes of 1.0cm in diameter underneath the belly, and back set with a cylindrical base with scrolling flowers. With vivid shapes and lustrous color, this pair of candle stickers is a rare treasure.

name: 红陶鸭形壶
intro: 该器型为马桥文化典型器。整器状似鸭禽，大口小尾，卷沿束颈，扁弧鼓腹，圜底内凹，背部附一宽扁桥形鋬。泥质红陶质，口沿施弦纹，器表遍施拍印曲折纹，鋬与壶身黏合处堆饰乳钉。马桥文化内涵独特，陶器以泥质陶为主，流行拍印纹饰，盛贮器多圜底内凹，以凹弧形足鼎，圜底内凹罐，鸭形壶，浅腹三足盘，云雷纹硬陶簋、尊、觯、石镰，半月形石刀等构成典型器物群，是极具地域性特色的早期印纹陶文化。目前考古所见的鸭形壶均为泥质红陶，用途当属盛水器。

name: 鸟形黑衣陶提梁壶
intro:
此器属泥质黑衣陶，鸟形，上部有一稍前倾圆口流，后端有斜翘的尾，背置半环形提梁，椭圆腹微鼓，平底，黑衣大部分已剥落。它的造型圆浑饱满，形体稳重优美，突出身躯部分，首和足均作省略处理，上部圆口短流与钩形短尾似鸟禽首尾。古代越人尊鸟为祖，以鸟为图腾，先民予以神化崇拜，将其形态模拟成器，不但可供实用，亦可供欣赏。这种鸟形提梁壶，在吴县唯亭草鞋山、吴江梅堰、上海福泉山良渚文化遗址中均有出土，为良渚文化时期典型器。
Bird-shaped Pot with a Handle
Material: Pottery
Period: Prehistoric Period
This pot is made of black pottery and in the shape of a bird. The surface of the black pottery has peeled off. The Yue people used to revere birds as their ancestors and took birds as their totem. Vessels made in the shape of birds are for using and appreciation. This kind of bird-shaped pot with a handle is a typical artifact of Liangzhu Culture, and was excavated from several sites of Liangzhu Culture such as Caoxieshan and Meiyan in Suzhou and Fuquanshan in Shanghai.

name: 玉钺
intro:
此玉钺呈淡青色，有黄褐斑，温润品莹，半透明，经鉴定为阳起石软玉。体扁薄，平面呈长梯形，顶窄刃宽，两侧斜直，双面弧刃，刃口无使用痕迹。肩部一角有意截去，留有割痕。中上部有对钻圆孔。玉钺是由作为复合生产工具的带柄穿孔石斧发展而来的，形似后来的大斧，有穿孔，安装长柄，作为兵器或刑具，用于砍杀，后来逐步变为制作精致、没有使用价值的礼器，成为当时特权显贵的权杖，作为军事首领的象征物。
Jade Axe
Material: Jade
Period: Prehistoric Period
This jade axe is light green with yellowish-brown spots, warm and translucent, and is identified as a nephrite. Jade axes are developed from stone axes with holes and handles, a kind of compound production tool. The corner of a shoulder was deliberately sliced with nicks left. Axes equipped with holes and handles were invented as weapons and instruments of torture. Later axes became exquisite ritual objects without using functions, scepters of nobles and symbols of military commanders.

name: 石耘田器
intro:
长13.7厘米，刃宽14厘米，厚0.5厘米
草鞋山遗址出土，新石器时代良渚文化时期
器形略作月牙形，圆弧刃，凹弧背，弧边内收，翼角起翘，背中部起凸榫，下有圆形穿孔，磨制精细，造型独特。这类石器属良渚文化的典型器，在杭州水田畈、吴兴钱山漾、苏州越城遗址等地均有同类器型出土。
但是，学术界对其定名与用途却颇具争议，归纳起来大致有“石刀”、”“耘田器”、“石耜冠”、“石锄”等几种意见。除“石刀”外，其他三种命名都认为其用途是跟稻作农业相关，犹以“耘田器”之说影响最大，认为是良渚时期稻作行栽技术下，中耕耘田除草的专门工具。
Stone Hoe for Weeding
Material: Stone
Period: Prehistoric Period
Length: 13.7cm, Width of Blade: 14cm, Thickness: 0.5cm
Excavated from the Caoxieshan Site, Liangzhu Culture of Neolithic Period
It’s a kind of typical artifact of the Neolithic Liangzhu culture. Stone artifacts of the same kind are excavated from the Shuitianfan Site in Hangzhou, the Qianshanyang Site in Wuxing and Yuecheng Site in Suzhou. There are controversies about its name and use. Among those disputes, the name of ""Stone Hoe for Weeding"" has the greatest influence. And it is considered a special tool for weeding during the rice cultivation in the Liangzhu period.
Its arc blade is circular and the back of the arc is concave up. The two sides of the arc are carved inward. The two wing angles are cocked up, and there is a tenon on the middle of the back part and a round hole under it. It has a unique shape and is well-polished.

name: 双孔石刀
intro:
长12.2厘米，厚0.7 厘米，刃宽17.6厘米
草鞋山遗址出土
新石器时代良渚文化时期
形状规则，磨制光滑，刀体扁平，作长方形，刃边稍长，背边略短，侧边微弧。双面开刃，刃角稍外撇，刀身居中靠近背部穿双孔，刀身长宽比不足1.5。刀身四边精磨痕迹明显，留有刃缘棱线，双孔皆为两面管钻，留有台痕。长方形石刀初见于仰韶文化晚期，在我国新石器时代分布广泛，一般器形不大，常见者多是一孔、双孔，在南京北阴阳营遗址还曾出土有三孔、五孔、七孔的长方形石刀多件。

name: 黑衣陶鳖形壶
intro:
高10.6厘米，口径4.7厘米，腹径17厘米
澄湖遗址出土
新石器时代良渚文化时期
状如黑鳖，身体长圆光滑，背部隆起，四周裙边和背脊作成断凿状附加堆纹，四爪微伸，成各带两个针眼小孔的鋬系，翘首，头端开口成壶嘴，体后有一小短尾。从器形来看，壶体为空腹，且腹部胎壁极薄，上下腹系捏塑粘接而成，成型工艺要求极高，可见当时已具有相当先进的制陶技术。而以鳖造型的良渚时代陶器，至今尚未发现第二件。
Turtle-shaped Pot
Material: Pottery
Period: Prehistoric Period
Height: 10.6cm, Mouth Diameter: 4.7cm, Belly Diameter: 17cm
Excavated from the Chenghu Lake Site, Liangzhu Culture of Neolithic Period
This is the only turtle-shaped pottery pot of the Liangzhu Culture, showing the superb craftsmanship. The pot is made in the shape of a black crouching turtle with a long and smooth body, and a raised back. Its four claws slightly extend, each of which has two holes. Its head is raised as a spout. There is a small short tail at the end of its body. The molding process is demanding, which reflects the advanced pottery technology at that time.

name: 古琴
intro:
琴身形似平底独木船，为楸枫类整木斫制，木质坚硬。面板无存，首部方形，刻凿有长方形弦槽，槽底钻有 12 个透孔，首部弦槽缺损一块，尾部山字形凸起，一角残断，枘槽内略残缺，首部弧高 1.1 厘米，尾部弧高 1.7 厘米。琴身髹黑漆，剥落严重，仅首尾留存。
古琴是我国最早的弹拨乐器，是中华民族的文化瑰宝。这件古琴具有明确的出土地点和断代依据，为我国目前发现为数不多先秦时期琴的实物之一，具有重要的科学研究价值，是珍贵的国家一级文物。
Guqin (Plucked Chinese Musical Instrument)
Material: Bamboo and Wood
Period: Pre-Qin Period
This instrument, similar to a flat-bottomed canoe in shape, was made of paulownia wood (Sterculia plantanifolia), and the panel is missing. The top is a square carved with rectangular chord grooves. Twelve through-holes are at the bottom of the grooves, and the chord groove in the head part is damaged. The tail bulges in the shape of the Chinese character “山(mountain)”. The body of the instrument was painted with black lacquer which has peeled off severely.
Guqin is the oldest plucked instrument in China and is a cultural treasure of the Chinese people. As a real object of musical instrument in the pre-Qin period with a clear excavation site and dating basis, it has important scientific research value and is a precious national first-class cultural relic.

name: 鹦鹉首拱形玉饰
intro:
弧长8.4厘米，宽3厘米，厚0.5厘米
严山玉器窖藏出土
春秋时期
此器玉色淡绿，内蕴墨绿色斑点，光洁莹润。器呈拱形筒瓦状，剖面为弧形，弧长接近半圆。两端作对称鹦鹉首形，高肉冠，钩喙，头部各有直径0.4厘米的穿孔，似为目。头部边沿琢出细密的阳线羽状纹。颈与器体相连。器表以“田”形阴刻线分隔，分布四组繁密的蟠虺纹。器里无纹，有蜡质光泽。
这件玉饰器应是在一筒瓦形坯料上加工完成的，两端琢成互为对称的侧面鹦鹉头像，鹦鹉仅取头部，身躯部分为适应玉坯弧度和器种形体的要求作了压缩和省略，有强烈的图案意味。两端鹦鹉首突出钩喙、肉冠及眼部，这三部分的实际尺寸要比真实的比例大得多，作品在写实基础上作了夸张处理。这种抓住形象特征，进行概括、提炼的艺术设计，显示出春秋吴国鲜明的文化风貌，目前仅见此一例。
Arched Jade Ornament with Parrot Heads on Two Ends
Material: Jade
Period: Pre-Qin Period
Arc Length: 8.4cm, Width: 3cm, Thickness: 0.5cm
Excavated from Yanshan
Spring and Autumn Period
The jade is light green in color, with dark green flecks within, polished and glossy. This jade ornament was made on a piece of tile-shaped raw material. The two ends of it are carved into symmetrical parrot heads in profile, with high combs and hooked beaks. The small holes are taken as parrots’ eyes. Their bodies are compressed and omitted to suit the curvature of the jade and the shape of the ornament. The beaks, eyes, and crests are highlighted, showing a kind of realism-based exaggeration. This kind of artistic design, which grasps and generalizes the core image characteristics, shows the distinct cultural style of the Wu state in the Spring and Autumn Period. This is the only one parrot-shaped jade ornament in the Pre-Qin period.

name: 虎形玉佩
intro:
长11.9厘米，宽3.8厘米，厚0.1-0.3厘米
严山玉器窖藏出土
春秋时期
虎形玉佩为一对，形制大小相同。玉色灰白夹黑。扁平体，虎作伏卧状，头微昂，有一小孔，似为目，亦可绶系，腹下四足屈蹲，卷尾高翘，背脊琢出扉棱。正面以减地斜切法阴刻变体夔纹，填以羽状细划纹。反面光素，留有直线锯痕四道。据其反面锯痕观察，两佩是从同一器胎上切割琢成，分面两器，合而为一。两虎造型生动，纹饰线条粗犷遒劲，刀法犀利有力。古人将雕成虎形的玉器称为“琥”，根据目前考古发现的情况来看，这种用玉琢成的虎形器均是佩饰品。
Tiger-shaped Jade Ornaments
Material: Jade
Period: Pre-Qin Period
Length: 11.9cm, Width: 3.8cm, Thickness: 0.1-0.3cm
Excavated from Yanshan
Spring and Autumn Period
The tiger-shaped jade ornaments are a pair of the same shape and size, and with their heads slightly raised on which there are holes like eyes, four legs bent, tails curled up, and back ridges carved into protruding strips. The jade color is gray and white with black. On the front side, they are obliquely incised with the variant Kui dragon design as in a bas-relief and are filled with feather shaped fine lines. The two tigers look vivid, and the decorative lines on them are rugged and powerful, demonstrating splendid craftsmanship. Tiger-shaped jade objects were called “Hu” in ancient times, and they were accessories according to archaeological findings.

name: 楚途盉
intro:
通高25.2厘米，提梁高8.5厘米，足高6.8厘米，口径10.8厘米，重4105克
何山东周墓出土
春秋时期
盉为古代青铜酒器，大腹敛口，前有长流，后有鋬，有盖，下多为三足，盛行于商代及西周初期。此器器身有铭“楚叔之孙途为之盉”。“途”当为人名，文献中未见记载，但根据李零等同志对“楚叔之孙倗”的考证，认为“倗”应该是蓬子冯。“楚叔之孙途”也应与楚王族同出，并可能与蓬子冯有亲属关系，当属于楚国贵族用器。
周敬王十四年（前506年），吴王阖闾、伍员率兵攻入楚之郢都。因此，此墓出土的楚国铜器，很可能是吴人掠回的战利品，赐给攻楚的功臣，死后随葬的。墓主人可能是这次攻楚有功之人。墓葬的年代，估计应在周敬王十四年吴楚战争结束后或稍晚。
Chu Tu He
Material: Metal
Period: Pre-Qin Period
Height: 25.2cm, Height of Handle: 8.5cm, Height of Feet: 6.8cm, Mouth Diameter: 20.5cm, Weight: 4105g
Excavated from an Eastern Zhou Tomb at Heshan
Spring and Autumn Period
He, an ancient bronze wine vessel with a big belly, a contracted mouth, a long spout, a single ear, a lid, and usually three feet, was popular in the Shang Dynasty (1600 BC-1046 BC) and the early Western Zhou Dynasty (1046 BC-771 BC). The inscription on the vessel mainly means that the He belonged to Tu, descendant of Chu Shu. Tu should be a name, but this person is not recorded in history. According to the research of “Peng, descendant of Chu Shu” by Li Ling and other scholars, Peng should be Peng Zifeng. In this connection, Tu should also be a member of the royal family of Chu, and Peng Zifeng’s relative. This vessel belonged to a noble of Chu.
In 506 BC, King Helu of Wu and Wu Zixu led their troops to attack Ying, capital of Chu. Therefore, it is likely that the bronze vessel of Chu unearthed in this tomb was the spoil of war. The date of the tomb is estimated to be after the end of the war between Wu and Chu in 506 BC or later.

name: 双耳弦纹乳丁足罐
intro:
直径8.5厘米，高23.4厘米
西塘河遗址出土
战国时期
该器为泥质黑衣陶器，是战国时期吴越文化的典型器物。敛口束颈，溜肩弧腹，平底，下附三乳钉足，肩部对置两泥条贯耳，耳上各有凹槽两道，器表除颈部抹光外，遍布细密弦纹。整器造型规整匀称，系快轮制作成形，器表弦纹既是制作痕迹又成为富有特色的装饰元素。露胎处灰白细腻，黑陶衣均匀稳定，相较于同期其他地域的陶器，展现出高超的制陶水平，与太湖流域良渚文化时期黑衣陶器传统遥相呼应，代表了瓷器时代来临前传统泥质陶器发展最后的高峰
Blake Pottery Jar with Tubular Ears
Material: Pottery
Period: Pre-Qin Period
Diameter: 8.5cm, Height: 23.4cm
Excavated from Xitanghe Site
Warring States Period
Made of black clay, the jar is a typical artifact of the Wuyue culture of the Warring States Period (475 BC-221 BC). It has a contracted mouth and neck, a sloping shoulder, a curved belly, a flat bottom, three mammillated feet, two tubular ears on the shoulder, two grooves on each ear, and horizontal lines all over the surface except for the neck. The jar is in a standard shape. The horizontal lines on the surface are both production traces and characteristic decorative elements. The grayish white and fine texture of the exposed paste and the uniformity and stability of the black pottery coating show a high level of pottery making technique compared with pottery from other regions of the same period, echoing the tradition of black pottery from the Liangzhu culture of the Taihu basin and representing the last peak of the development of traditional clay pottery before the dawn of the porcelain era.

name: 青瓷灶
intro:
西晋
通高14.0厘米，长20.8厘米，宽14.5厘米
枫桥狮子山一号墓出土
整体呈船形，尾端上翘，开一圆形排烟孔。一端开方形火膛，灶面塑可活动的两个锅。旁有一碗，高足外撇，底镂九个小孔，碗内置一勺。通体施青釉，存在脱釉现象。六朝墓葬中多随葬青瓷仓罐、灶、箕等模型明器，反映了当时庄园经济的繁荣。

name: 西晋青釉瓷狗圈
intro:
西晋
高5.2厘米，口径15.0厘米，底径10.0厘米
枫桥狮子山一号墓出土
钵形，平底，腹部饰弦纹，内底饰细密的弦纹。钵内塑昂首的狗一只，前脚伏地，后腿紧蹬，尾上翘。通体施青釉，底露红褐色胎。这件青瓷狗圈造型简洁，狗形象塑造生动，体现了一定的青瓷烧造水平。

name: 顾叔声六面铜印
intro: 印体为正方体，印纽下有一圆形穿，可穿系携带。此印纽顶、印体及底都刻有印文，纽顶刻“白记”，印体“臣楮”等。六面印流行于东晋时期，印文一般分为两类，一类记述印主姓名、字表、家族地望、职官身份等；另一类为文书用语，如“白记”“白事”“白笺”等，反映了当时的文书格式和封缄制度。六面印的印文，多修长秀美，竖画的末端作“蚊子脚”状，称“悬针篆”。此印沾红色印泥，可能为墓主生前使用之物。

name: 越窑青瓷楼阁式堆塑罐
intro:
通高46.5厘米，底径14厘米，腹径24.7厘米
枫桥狮子山一号墓出土
西晋
堆塑罐，又称魂瓶，谷仓罐，是我国长江中下游地区三国两晋时期墓葬中的一种特有的随葬器物。这件堆塑罐集多种题材的装饰于一体，图案繁复，造型奇特，应是其极盛阶段的产物。堆塑罐的制作技艺极为繁复，口、腹部系分段拉坯粘接而成，底部和屋檐则采用拍片成型法，佛像与鸟兽则采用了模印、捏塑，同时结合镂、雕、刻、划等手法，说明当时越窑青瓷已具备相当高的制作水平。
Celadon Figured Jar Produced by Yue Kiln
Material: Porcelain
Period: Wei, Jin and Southern and Northern Dynasties
Height: 46.5cm, Base Diameter: 14cm, Belly Diameter: 24.7cm
Excavated from No.1 Tomb of Shizishan, Suzhou
Western Jin Dynasty
Figured jar, also known as barn jar or soul jar, is a kind of unique grave good in the tombs of the Three Kingdoms and the Jin Dynasty in the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River in China. With decorations of multiple themes, this jar was produced using complex techniques, indicating that Yue Kiln had a high level of celadon production ability.

name: 青瓷扁壶
intro:
高25.8厘米，口径5.4厘米，腹宽23厘米，足宽19厘米
枫桥狮子山一号墓出土
西晋
扁壶是一种水器。此壶器身扁圆形，方唇直口，饰凹弦纹一道，肩部以圆圈和菱形组成装饰带。前、后腹面以圆圈环带联成鸡心状，并贴塑铺首衔环各一个。肩部左右有一系，腹部各有系二。椭圆形高圈足，外撇。表面施茶绿色透明釉，圈足底内不施釉，露胎处呈褐红色。
此壶1976年出土于枫桥狮子山一号墓，同墓伴出有“元康五年七月十八日”纪年砖，是一件有绝对纪年可考的器物。这件扁壶形体浑厚，釉色滋润，装饰精细，制作精湛，作为有绝对纪年的断代标准器，历史、艺术、文物价值极高。
Celadon Flat Pot Produced by Yue Kiln
Material: Porcelain
Period: Wei, Jin and Southern and Northern Dynasties
Height: 25.8cm, Mouth Diameter: 5.4cm, Width of Belly: 23cm, Width of Base: 19cm
Excavated from No.1 Tomb of Shizishan, Suzhou
Western Jin Dynasty
Flat flask is a kind of water container. With a flat and round body, a square rim and a straight mouth, it is decorated with a concave horizontal line, and its shoulder is decorated with bands of circles and lozenges. There are two decorations in the shape of beast face with ring on its belly.
This flask was excavated from a tomb of Western Jin Dynasty. A brick inscribed with “Yuankan”, an era name of Emperor Hui of Jin was unearthed too. In this connection, this object has an absolute date. It is of great historical, artistic, and cultural relic value with its simple shape, delicate decorations and exquisite production.

name: 白瓷双系小罐
intro:
口径3.1厘米，腹径5.5厘米，底径1.6厘米，高4.8厘米
隋朝
白瓷是经高温烧成的一种胎色洁白、釉色白净的瓷器。此罐侈口，束颈，圆鼓腹，肩部置环形双系。器表施薄釉，部分露胎，釉面润泽。这件白瓷双系小罐器形小巧，釉面纯净润泽，是白瓷创烧阶段的一件佳品。

name: 双鸾瑞兽纹铜镜
intro:
铜镜是以铜锡合金为原料铸造，镜面光素用以照容，镜背装饰花纹或铭文。该镜呈八瓣菱花形，镜背分三层纹饰布局，镜背中央伏卧一兽，腹下有一孔，形成镜纽。内切圆将纹饰分为内外两区，外区分饰八组飞鸟、蝴蝶和花草纹，内区饰双鸾双兽，间饰缠枝莲纹。鸾鸟瑞兽纹铜镜是盛唐时期最流行的镜类，从纪年镜的资料中可知，大约成镜于武则天长寿年间，菱花镜也始铸于这一时期。此镜中鸾鸟、瑞兽和花鸟线条简练流畅，鸟羽细腻分明，是唐镜中的精品。
Bronze Mirror Decorated with Mythical Birds and Auspicious Animals
Material: Metal
Period: Tang Dynasty
The mirror is made of bronze. The front is a shiny polished surface and can be used as a mirror, and the back is decorated with patterns or inscriptions. The mirror is in the shape of a water chestnut flower with eight petals. In the middle, a prostrate animal is depicted. In the outer part of this mirror, there are bird patterns, butterfly patterns and flower and plant patterns. In the inner part, it is decorated with patterns of mythical birds and auspicious animals. There are also patterns of interlocking lotus. This kind of bronze mirror was very popular in the Tang Dynasty, and appeared under Wu Zetian’s reign.

name: 长沙窑褐釉绿彩瓷壶
intro:
口径8.6厘米 底径10.6厘米 高16.4厘米
唐
这件壶属于唐代长沙窑彩绘瓷器，直口，高颈，直腹微鼓，肩、颈置双条形系。胎质较细密，釉色发黄，有剥釉现象。腹部绘褐彩莲瓣纹，中间饰绿彩圆斑。
长沙窑又称铜官窑，窑场分布于湖南长沙望城县铜官镇一带，始烧于唐，盛于晚唐至五代。其器型涵盖罐、壶、碗等多种生活实用器，并以褐绿彩绘、模印贴花和诗文装饰等为特色。
Painted Pot with Two Rings Produced by Changsha Kiln
Material: Porcelain
Period: Tang Dynasty
Mouth Diameter: 8.6cm, Bottom Diameter: 10.6cm, Height: 16.4cm
The painted pot with two rings produced by Changsha Kiln has a straight mouth, high neck, and slightly bulging body decorated with brown lotus petal patterns and green round spots in the center. 
Changsha Kiln, also known as Tongguan Kiln, is located in Tongguan Town, Changsha City, Hunan Province. Changsha Kiln started to fire wares in Tang Dynasty, and flourished in the late Tang Dynasty to Five Dynasties. Products including jars, pots and bowls were produced, and they are characterized by brown and green paintings, applied designs and poem decorations.

name: 八瓣菱花形铜镜
intro:
直径11.2厘米，通高0.5厘米，重340克
唐
这枚唐代的菱花镜分八瓣，镜背中央置一圆钮，下有孔。内切圆将镜背分为内、外两区，外区花瓣中间隔分布八组连枝花叶纹和蜻蜓纹，内区饰四只飞翔的鸿雁，中间以卷草纹相隔。菱花镜是唐代的一种常见镜式。

name: 三彩凤首执壶
intro:
高17.35厘米 口径6厘米 腹径9.8厘米 足径5.8厘米
唐
这件三彩凤首执壶是唐代的低温铅釉陶器，此壶盘口，外侈，束颈，鼓腹，肩部贴饰双环形系，颈部刻两道弦纹，口沿至上腹部连接一凤首执柄，另一侧肩部饰一小凤首。器身施黄、绿、褐三彩釉，色彩艳丽，下腹及底部有剥釉现象。
凤首执壶流行于隋代和唐初，唐三彩中多见此器型。唐三彩是一种低温铅釉陶器，创烧于初唐，晚唐时衰弱，分布于西安、洛阳和扬州等地的唐代墓葬中，多属于随葬的明器，也有生活实用器及建筑构件等。
Tri-colored Ewer with Phoenix Head-shaped Handle
Material: Pottery
Period: Tang Dynasty
Height: 17.35cm, Mouth Diameter: 6cm, Belly Diameter: 9.8cm, Base Diameter: 5.8cm
Tri-colored wares are a type of lead-glazed earthenware fired at a lower temperature. With a dish-shaped mouth, bulging body, two horizontal lines around the neck, a handle in the shape of phoenix’s head linking the rim and the upper belly, and a phoenix’s head on the other side of the shoulder, the ewer is covered with yellow, green and brown glazes.
Ewers with phoenix’s head handle were popular during Sui and Tang Dynasties. Tri-colored wares appeared in the early Tang Dynasty, and declined in the late Tang Dynasty. They are distributed in the tombs of Tang Dynasty in Xi’an, Luoyang, Yangzhou and other cities. Most of them are grave goods and there are also objects for daily use and architectural components.

name: 越窑秘色瓷金口碗
intro:
高5.4厘米 口径14.8厘米 足径6.1厘米
五代
此器敞口、斜弧腹，平底小圈足，口沿镶金扣，底部有支钉痕。器身施湖水绿釉，釉层腴润，具有玉质感，是秘色瓷碗中的精品。秘色瓷是越窑烧制的一种薄胎致密、施釉均匀、釉色青翠的精致青瓷，始烧于唐，盛行于五代和北宋初期。
Secret Color Ceramic Bowl with Golden Rim
Material: Porcelain
Period: Five Dynasties
Height: 5.4cm, Mouth Diameter: 14.8, Base Diameter: 6.1cm
The bowl has an open mouth, flat bottom with a ring foot, and golden-gilded rim. It is decorated with smooth green glazing, has jade texture, and represents a celadon bowl with finest quality. Secret color ware is a particularly refined form of Yue ware produced by Yue Kiln and characterized by a smooth and thin green glaze. They were first produced in the Tang Dynasty and became popular in the Five Dynasties and early Northern Song Dynasty.

name: 越窑秘色瓷方形高足套盘
intro:
长14厘米 宽13.7厘米 高6.6厘米
七子山五代墓出土
五代
这组越窑秘色瓷方形高足套盘，共9件，每件形状和花纹一致。盘作四方体，四角出花棱。子口，内壁略斜收，可互相套叠。高圈足，足壁呈须弥式，四边镂壸门，外饰凸线纹，刻阴线。器表施水绿色釉，釉质滋润。同墓室还出土了秘色瓷金口碗、秘色瓷洗、鎏金饰件等一百多件文物，可能为五代时期吴越国的贵族墓。
Secret Color Square Ceramic Plate Set
Material: Porcelain
Period: Five Dynasties
Length: 14cm, Width: 13.7cm, Height: 6.6cm
Excavated from Qizi Hill
This set of nine secret color square ceramic plates produced by Yue Kiln is of the same shape and pattern and the plates can be placed one on another. The high base is in the shape of Sumeru Mountain. The surface is covered by fine aqua glaze. Over 100 cultural relics including a secret color ceramic bowl with golden rim and gilding ornaments are excavated from the same tomb which may be the tomb of a noble of Wuyue State in the Five Dynasties.

name: 影青粉盒
intro:
南宋
通高5.6厘米，腹径8.8厘米，底径5.0厘米
斜塘琼姬墩南宋景定三年墓出土
青白瓷釉色青中显白，白中泛青，又称“影青”，形成于宋代，是由景德镇创烧的一种风格独特的瓷器。青白釉瓷器胎骨洁白，釉料中三氧化二铁含量低于0.99％，釉质细薄，晶莹润泽，质感如玉。胎体极薄，显出一点淡青色暗影，其余几乎都是白色，故又有映青、隐青、罩青之名。
这件粉盒整体呈圆形，分盖、体两部分。器体为子口，扁腹，璧形底。圆盖面堆塑折枝菊花，一花五叶，自然飘逸，花朵为圆形，点卵白色彩釉，花蕊凸起，叶为浅刻，叶脉清晰。器表施青白釉，盖沿、圈足露赫红色胎。此器制作古朴典雅，堪称影青瓷中的杰作。
